comments:
I clicked on my desktop icon to start my RAD 6.0.1 which uses eclipse 3.0.2. After several minutes of inactivity, and no sign that RAD had started, I clicked again.  There were some warning messages that I replied to and both instances of eclipse shut down.  There after, I cannot start RAD. Not sure if this is relevant but the environment is part of the Websphere Commerce toolkit which uses RAD and eclipse underneath.

Unfortunately due to a bug in Eclipse 3.0, the cause of the real error has been lost here because there is a secondary error during recovery from the first error (bug 134465).  You can try deleting the file workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.snap to see if it allows you to recover.

Apart from that, the runtime should have prevented a second instance from being started simultaneously with the first.  Are there any other errors in your log?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Unfortunately due to a bug in Eclipse 3.0, the cause of the real error has been
> lost here because there is a secondary error during recovery from the first
> error (bug 134465).  You can try deleting the file
> workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.snap to see if it
> allows you to recover.
> Apart from that, the runtime should have prevented a second instance from being
> started simultaneously with the first.  Are there any other errors in your log?

I deleted the .snap file and the workbench starts but it was not able to recover any of my projects.  The original error isn't present.  I know that I deleted the .log file at least once during my attempts to restart in order to make it more readable.  I can tell you that my machine did have a hard crash while RAD was open unrelated to rad, prior to this problem. Now that it starts is there any more that can be done to recover my workspace?
This was never reproduced, and there isn't enough information here to investigate further. Please reopen if you see this problem in Eclipse 3.3 or newer.

causedBy.message: The resource tree is locked for modifications.

traces.message: The resource tree is locked for modifications.
